over the top I think we've nailed that

color that and melt it in the microwave
you could use real chocolate here but
I've used compound to make it simpler

put some baking paper under one side of

let it firm up a little bit and then

cool

they're basically just a little

the outside of the cake we are going to
use this it's not going to be wasted
because there's a lot of cream there pop
some gelatin sheets into some water to
soften and take some chocolate and pour
over some hot milk over the top now I am
putting recipe quantities for all of
this on my howtocookthat.net website for
you if you need to rescue a cake all the
details will be there for you leave that
to sit for a couple of minutes and then
give it a stir pour a small amount of
that into a smaller bowl and squeeze out
the water from the gelatin and add it in
then pop that smaller bowl into the
microwave for about 10 seconds to heat
it up and make sure that gelatin is
melted pour that in with the rest of the
chocolate and let it cool down to room
temperature you don't want to add the
cream when it's still warm
line a cake tin with acetate or any food
safe plastic that you may have then grab
the top layer of the cake and gently
drop it down to the bottom add the cream
and the sprinkles that we scraped off
the cake into the chocolate mixture and
fold them together to make a nice easy
chocolate mousse pour some of the mousse
on top of the cake and then add the next
layer more mousse and in the fine
layer of cake and then the rest of the
mousse on top of that then that needs to
go into the fridge to set or into the
freezer if you're in a hurry
once it is set peel off the acetate add
